alert.note: Alert for Blaine (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 2:08AM MDT until April 11 at 8:52PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Great Falls MT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River near Harlem affecting Blaine County. ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Montana... Big Sandy Creek at Havre affecting Hill County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Milk River...including areas near Harlem and Fort Belknap... Minor flooding is forecast. For the Big Sandy Creek...including Havre...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River near Harlem. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, the Milk River near Harlem is bankfull. Some minor problems can occur near and along the river from Chinook to east of Harlem. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 AM MDT Tuesday the stage was 21.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:30 AM MDT Tuesday was 21.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.5 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.6 feet on 05/24/1967. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued as necessary this afternoon at 315 PM MDT.
